page.title: 19CALVERLEY PLAYERS
page.content: Calverley Players was founded in 1942. At present it has a membership of fifty.The Annual General Meeting is held in Calverley Library. They have three plays per season which they perform in the Mechanics Institute. Their plays vary from comedies to serious drama. It is usual to hold the plays on four separate nights which is asking for a large commitment in time and energy from an amateur company. In 1985 the admission prices are Â£1 for adults and 75 pence for children and old age pensioners.They get quite full audiences though mainly of local paople. The society enters drama festivals and they have had a considerable success.Winners at Bradford Theatre Guild 10 times and 17 times at Wharfedale Drama Festival.
